   "body_snippet": "I would like to be able to search for keywords inside the session window directly.\r\n\r\nExpected Behavior\r\nI would like to have a search button to search inside the session windows output for a certain word which jumps to the keyword. \r\n\r\nCurrent Behavior\r\nCurrently option not available\r\n\r\nPossible Solution\r\nProvide an option to search for keywords\r\n\r\nSteps to Reproduce (for bugs)\r\nN.A.\r\n\r\nYour Environment\r\nVersion used: 1.75.7012.16814\r\nOperating System and version (e.g. Windows 10 1709 (x64)",

 }

   "github_updated_at": "2018-11-01T18:46:14Z",
   "body_snippet": "Simple question I hope, love the program :-)\r\n\r\nI work with VMware and Nutanix, I'm looking for something to simply import bookmarks.html in mRemoteNG, instead of doing a scan all over the world in our network.\r\n\r\nAnd instead of config view, I like to have right-click and properties/config\r\n",

-  "iterations": [],

+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-16",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "Implement a new importer for browser-exported bookmarks.html files; the 'right-click properties' requirement should be satisfied by standard connection behavior after import."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [],
   "comments_cursor": "2018-11-01T18:46:14Z",

   "needs_action": false,
   "waiting_for_us": false,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): Implement a new importer for browser-exported bookmarks.html files; the 'right-click properties' requirement should be satisfied by standard connection behavior after import.\nApproach: Create BookmarksHtmlImporter implementing IConnectionImporter to parse standard NETSCAPE-Bookmark-file-1 format and register it in App.Import.cs."
 }
